40475644.review:
A simple puzzle game skinned as a dungeon delver. The game feels like it gives multiple quests for the same dungeon to pad play time. Most dungeon quests require that you beat the same dungeon with multiple characters to complete a quest. However, a lot of these quests don't even seem to be tailored to the class or race that was specified by the quest. I felt like the game turned into a slog. A chore of sorts. New dungeons can be fun, but beating the same dungeon more than once never felt rewarding or enhanced my experience with the game outside of trying out a new character.

There are also some mechnics in the game that are not obvious at first and take some getting used to such as the XP mechanic. The game explains these mechanics in tutorial levels and how to play the game 'properly'. It almost felt as if the game was explaining how to abuse the damage and healing mechanics just to beat regular levels. It was certainly not what I was expecting from the game as I continually got bogged down doing math in my head to try to get to level 9 with full health and a mana pot just to have a chance at beating the level 10 boss. It was very frustrating to get to level 9, but realise I had taken too much damage or was a few points of faith away from getting the altar spell I needed to beat the boss. To summarise, it was not the kind of game I was expecting. I should have looked into the game further before purchasing it.

39654474.review:
[strike]想了很久，到底是写推荐还是不推荐，最后决定还是写个不推荐吧[/strike]

[b]如果你对该游戏已有了解，并且确实喜欢这类游戏，那么可以跳过这篇评测了。
如果你对这个游戏不够了解，希望你剁手之前三思[/b]

[h1]缺点[/h1]
 - [u]在地下城中无法存档[/u]
    我相信存档其实不难做到，制作者这样设定可能是为了防止玩家手动利用存档来撤销他们的行为。但是，无法存档对于我这样游戏时间不稳定的玩家太难受了。这个游戏需要一定的思考和计算，一局游戏的时长很容易到30分钟以上，如果你中途有些事情需要离开，那么不好意思，要么你一直开着电脑；要么下次重来，这次作废。

 - [u]Roguelike设定过于硬核[/u]
    不像其他打着roguelike旗号，实则是roguelite的游戏，这款游戏是名副其实的roguelike：
[list]
    [*]奖励机制匮乏
        你通关的奖励只有两种：1.随机遇到的NPC会给你解锁新的东西，例如新建筑或者新的神等等。2.金币。
        大多数情况是第二种，而金币的作用是升级建筑来解锁更多的东西。换句话说，通关只能给你带来更多的选择，而并没有什么实质的提升。然而这些新的“选择”（新种族、职业等）对我来说越来越没什么吸引力了……感觉上无非是稍稍换了一些设定，比如人类是100转化点加10%攻击力，兽人是80转化点加2点攻击力——这对我来说实在不够新鲜。

    [*]失败的挫败感很强
        如果你失败了，那就是失败了——投资全部作废，就当这局游戏你没玩，还少了点钱。
        对于精通游戏的玩家，这并不是什么大问题——你很少会遇到这样的情况。但是我直到现在仍然记得游戏初期的无数次失败是多么痛苦。当然了，这一点十分主观，不同的人有不同的看法，你也可以说真正的roguelike本来就应该是这样。
[/list]
以上的缺点让我实在没有兴趣继续玩下去了，但是如果你问我这个游戏好不好玩，我仍然会毫不犹豫地告诉你：[b]好玩[/b]。


[h1]优点[/h1]
 - 多变的游戏过程
    各种职业、种族、道具、神明的组合，以及随机生成的地下城，可以让你每一局的游戏体验都不一样。这一点也正是游戏的魅力所在，不再赘述。[strike]我也不知道该怎么形容了，反正这种随机性就是很好玩，去看官方介绍吧[/strike]

 - 汉化质量值得称赞
    相信不少人都是被迷叔吸引过来的吧，汉化亮点游戏内自寻
    [spoiler]大人，没有了您的治理，这王国怕是药丸啊[/spoiler]

 - 多平台云存档
    这个游戏是有云存档的，跟着游戏内部的指引，在官网上创建账号并绑定steam，就有云存档了。
    另外，这个游戏有安卓版，可以在Google play下载，[strike]其实没有google套装也可以找其他渠道下载[/strike]并且可以与PC互通云存档。
    稍微提一下手机游玩的缺点：手机屏幕小，容易误触；而且最新版本是没有汉化的。

 - 非常有趣的谜题挑战
    其实谜题才是我一直坚持下去的动力……个人认为谜题的设定十分有趣，有点像是绞尽脑汁地解象棋残局一样，根本停不下来，实在是太好玩了

[h1]其他[/h1][list]
[*]游戏有中文，第一次进游戏之后，创建人物，退出游戏。再进游戏的时候，就可以在设定里面选择语言了。
[*]再说一遍，游戏是有手机版的，iOS应该也有。
[/list]
[spoiler]缺点都看完了，还看了后面那么多废话，别想了，买吧。
什么？你是直接跳到最后的？emmmmmm……[/spoiler]

38749060.review:
It's a puzzle game. Don't be fooled!

The introduction to the game, and the first couple of hours of play, make this seem like a classic RPG: upgrading characters, buliding your town, finding new races/classes, going on adventures.

It has a rogue-like feel in that every dungeon is unique, and you essentially start fresh each time. The initial dungeons (beyond the intro), are difficult. Gathering coins and getting any upgrades is  a time consuming process -- you either quit the dungeon and get pittance, or die and get nothing.

Early on you're introduced to a side-game, the puzzle adventures. These seemed like a nice little side twist...

...until you realize the whole game is actually a puzzle game. You need to plan every individual move, attack, and magic use far in advance to have any chance. The difficulty here is a real problem. The game doens't require planning a few moves ahead, or even 10 moves ahead, the "normal" dungeons seem to require extensive pre-planning.

I lost interest once I realized it was a pure puzzle game, and a tedious one at that.

Desktop Dungeons might look like a roguelike, but don't let that fool you. It is much of more a puzzle game. With a LOT of maths. But the good thing is that if you enjoy mathsy puzzle games, this one is amazing.

Like all good puzzle games the mechanics are very simple but leave enough space for a massive amount of variation. The amount of different character classes, monsters, and dungeons, that QCF managed to put into the game is staggering and gives the game with a huge potential playtime.

从Alpha版时代接触到这个游戏（现在应该还可以在官网免费下到）就很喜欢，后来买了现在这个版本，元素更丰富了。很令人惊喜的是今年居然还出了官中，真的很出乎意外，因为游戏内的英文有很多是很难翻译的英文梗。
其实我有挺长一段时间没玩了，但一旦玩就会玩很久。这里记录的八十几小时都是刚买来那会儿一口气玩的……我觉得这也是这游戏的一个特点，就是一旦开始玩就会钻研进去，而一旦生疏了，要再回到之前的技术水平又再需要重新熟悉各种战术套路。
这个游戏可能还是要看人，不喜欢的估计就是喜欢不起来，喜欢的甚至有社区小伙伴在100%这游戏后自己制作了超难版MOD（官方认可的）……但我觉得有一点毫无疑问，就是这个游戏元素真的很丰富，and is polished. 感兴趣在观望的人可以去官网找找alpha版试试水。

34730083.review:
I'm a big fan of roguelikes, which is why I originally got the alpha version of this game, but I actually wouldn't describe it as a roleplaying game at all. It's much more like a puzzle or game of chess, requiring careful thinking and planning several moves in advance to win. However, I quite enjoyed the alpha version so I bought the full version. 

I would recommend this game, not so much to lovers of roguelikes and roleplayers, but to puzzlers. Try out the free alpha version on their homepage before you spend your money to truly make sure you enjoy it.

34696706.review: Das Spiel ist trotz spartanischem, etwas alt erscheinende Aussehen wirklich unglaublich spaßig und fesselend. Jede Runde ist knifflig, dauert nur wenige Minuten und erfüllt einen mit einer Zufriedenheit, die kaum ein Spiel hervorbringt. Durch die zufallsgenerierte "Dungeon" ist jede Runde anders und herausfordernd. Wahrscheinlich hinterlässt das Spiel eine große Zufriedenheit, da nach jeder hart erkämpfte Runde Gold als Belohnung erwirtschaftet wird, mit dem man den Heimatdorf ausbaut um in zukünftigen Spielen weitere Boni zu haben. Und es gibt viel im Spiel zu tun, wer weiß wann man das Ende erreicht, die täglichen Quests mit Ranglisten hält das Spiel zusätzlich stets frisch. Ich bin auf der Suche nach ähnliche Spiele, jedoch hab ich noch keine gefunden, welche auf gleicher Höhe mithalten können. Jede für das Spiel ausgegebene Euro ist es wert, ich hab neben der Steamfassung noch die iOS Version gekauft um mit der iPad (Cross-Play dank Cloudsave!!!) noch mobiler spielen zu können [deswegen die gerigen Stunden hier in Steam] :) Absolute Empfehlung für ein tolles, individuelles, konkurrenzloses Spiel!

34395794.review:
For me, the game is a negative.  For you, it may be exactly what you're looking for, so read on.  

Screenshots and videos on the Steam store page are slightly misleading as to what type of game this is.  I see the screeshots and "Rogue-lite" description and immediately think it was going to be something with some strong RPG elements combined with some tactical strategy (since there is no forced rush during gameplay).  It's nice to be able to think out your next move without something bearing down on you, but the game is designed in a way that will force you to fail no matter how methodical you think you're being if you don't do things in the correct order.

I'm sure that you can pour hours into the game and "figure it out", but the reality is that the game isn't as engaging as the Steam store page would make you believe.  Re-doing the same level over and over again isn't appealing.  The numerous times that I sat staring at the final "boss" and couldn't do anything because they were higher level than me and was forced to restart (becuase I didn't do things "in the correct order") is what forces a negative review.  I'm always down for a good puzzle, but when it looks like an RPG, I want it to play like an RPG; which means that I should have at least some say in how I go about completing it based on my decisions, not the decisions the developers have already made for me.  

The "puzzle" in this game isn't the gameplay, it's the hidden framework of killing things in a certain order and is just masked behind an RPG skin.  You may be looking for this type of game, but I was not.

34058415.review:
[h1] プレイヤーの機知を試す、30分一本勝負[/h1]

※DLCを除く全クラスをアンロック、プレイ約100時間でのレビューです

ローグライクRPGは1ゲームの時間が短めとはいえ、それでもまだ長い、もっとあっさりとしたローグライクが遊びたいんだ！ってな時期がやってくることがあるのではないでしょうか。本作はローグライクの要素をギュッと凝縮し、パズル要素強めの作品として再構築したものです。1回のプレイは15～30分ほど、ちょっとした息抜きにちょうどよいですよ。

種族とクラス、持ち込みアイテムを選択して挑戦開始。約1画面のメインと小型のサブ複数で構成されたダンジョンに巣食うボスを倒すのが目標となります。ダンジョン内のリソースは限られているため、それらをいかに活用して自キャラを強くしていくかが肝。特に自分よりレベルの高い敵を倒すなどで得られるボーナスXPの取得が重要です。クラス特徴やアイテム、神の恩恵など手持ちの資源を活かせるよう脳みそをフル回転させて打開を目指します。

メインとなるダンジョン攻略部分の快適さはもちろん、クラスやアイテムのアンロックなども極めてサクサクと進んでいきます。しかしやりこめばやりこむほどに味が出てきて、なかなか底が見えません。各ダンジョンのクラスごとのクリア状況などをゲーム中で記録、閲覧が出来るようになっているのは嬉しいところ。細かいところまで気の届いている作りは、お手本にすべきものでしょう。

攻略情報についてはゲーム中の辞典と、公式のwikiが存在しています。当然ながら全て英語であり、日本語情報は今なおあまり充実していないようです。

極めて優れた作りゆえに、1ゲームが短くてももう1ゲームもう1ゲームと続けてしまう。この作品はローグライクの中毒性すらも凝縮したある意味では更にタチの悪い沼なのでございます。

33964493.review:
I loved the old Desktop Dungeons v0.2, so I thought I should try the new one.
The concept of 10-minute roguelique is awesome, and with each unlocked class, the game makes me adapt my strategy to the new class.

This version has some nice additions, such as the "puzzles", which are non-random tutorials and challenges.
The art style has been redone, but I liked the clarity of the low-res version.
The dungeons are more varied.
I haven't seen any altars yet but I guess they might unlock later on.

Some of the spells have been made more complex, unclear and weird. For example, the fireball spell now has 3 effects, even though the glyph tooltip only lists 2 of them. Burning enemies are supposed to receive extra damage when attacked, but strangely they also receive damage when I attack someone else.
The spell descriptions and effects tooltips are sometimes misleading or unclear.
The added music is pretty nice. 
There are various annoying bugs in the menu. For example, the "cloud save" button is greyed out, with no indication whatsoever on how to fix it, and the "login" button does nothing.

33852568.review:
Desktop Dungeon ist ein rundenbasiertes Strategiespiel mit Rouge-like-Elementen. Es gibt eine Vielzahl an Charakteren und Klassen freizuschalten. Dabei spielt sich jede spürbar anders und erhöht so den Wiederpsielwert enorm. Das Spiel ist so konzipiert, dass eine Spielrunde nur wenige Minuten dauert und so gut als Spiel für die kurze Pause genutzt werden kann. Durch Verknüpfung mit der Webseite, werden zum einen Spielstände in einer Cloud gespeichert (Nicht in der Steamcloud) und das Spiel soll dann auch im Browser gespielt werden können. Wer auf solche Spiel steht wird dem Spiel auch die Grindingkomponente verzeihen. Diese ist aber maßgeblich dafür, dass man viel spielen muss um alles zu entdecken. Beginnern empfehle ich dringend den einen oderen andern Userguide zu lesen, da es gerade zu Beginn sehr frustrierend sein kann. 

Ich hatte das Spiel mal in einem Sale gekauft. Den Normalpreis emfpinde ich für ein solches Spiel als zu hoch und auch dass es bereits 5 Jahre+ auf dem Buckel hat rechtfertigt nicht mehr diesen hohen Preis. Das ist aber ein steamtypisches Problem.

33375368.review:
Desktop Dungeons is like Mine Sweeper and a dungeons crawler mixed with a rogue like game. You start by selecting a character. You choose the race and class. Then you start at the first dungeon floor. The whole dungeon is covered in a fog if war. By exploring the tile next to you, you uncover the dungeon gradually. Along the way you will find enemies. They have levels. Killing a higher level enemies is hard, but gives you bonus xp. Killing a lower level enemies is easy but gives you less xp. Every time you explore a new square (that is covered by Fog of War) you get health and manna. All the onscreen enemies recover health. 

Between each dungeon is a kingdom that can be upgraded. Upgrading the kingdom unlocks new classes, races and items. 

Desktop Dungeons is a highly addictive game that I would recommend to any patient gamer.

32378853.review:
Surprisingly addictive dungeon-crawler, high strategy and low luck -- you only die when you've made a blunder, or backed yourself into a corner by poor planning.
(EDIT: If you're stuck and feel like giving up, google for "DDWiki" from QCF Designs which has info and guides to everything in the game. I avoided it until I was 100+ hours into the game since I wanted the fun of alot of trial and error.)
     This may seem like a simple hack-and-slash, but it's not. There's almost no luck and a surprising amount of planning involved. Each dungeon is like a puzzle, and might take 15-45 minutes to complete. You start each dungeon as a lowly level 1 character. Kill the monsters in a certian order and gain the power-ups at the right times and you will be able to defeat the boss-monster and thus "win" each dungeon.  if you randomly charge in like a hack-and-slash game, you won't maximize your powerups and you won't have enough health to tackle the tougher monsters. Same if you spend the power-ups too soon. If you don't defeat the tougher monsters, you don't gain the experience-point bonuses to increase your abilities enough to tackle the boss-monster. As you complete dungeons, you can unlock other character classes (again, you start each dungeon back as level 1). Since there's very little luck involved in combat, most of the time you will know the results of a combat before it happens, and can choose to either delay it until you are more powerful or press on. The game UI shows you how much damage you and your opponent will suffer each round of cobmat, and thus allow you to predict the result of each combat. Choosing to use magic glyphs and potions can also modify how a combat turns out. Therefore you only die when you've made a blunder, or backed yourself into a corner by poor planning.

EDIT: about the only negatives are that the class challenges are somewhat hard and might put off beginners. Also some of the Explorers Giuld puzzles are more like chess puzzles, in that one wrong move and you can't beat it. Again, give the DDwiki a look before giving up.

The art and story in a tongue-in-cheek way poke fun at the Fantasy Role Playing genre. The price is cheap and the play value is good. The game is supposedly based on the old networked Rogue game but I can't compare the two since I never played that.

31937275.review:
这个游戏在后期的难度会非常高，无间难度的关卡往往需要精细的准备和绞尽脑汁的思考才有可能通过（而且从困难难度开始的关卡大多都有初见杀），但在比较熟悉系统之后，在普通和困难的地图里，游戏会变得非常休闲轻松，是个杀时间的好工具。

我个人的建议是，不需要过于执着自己觉得太难的关卡，找到最适合自己的难度、慢慢摸索和体验不同的地图、种族、职业、道具和神祇的搭配，会让你获得更多乐趣。——在这一点上，这个游戏有着非常优秀的平衡性，只有少数几个种族/职业组合是公认的弱，大多数看似违背直觉的组合都有其强大之处和适应的地图，在对游戏有了一定程度的熟悉之后，不妨试着挑战一些自己比较陌生的组合，说不定能带来完全不同的体验。

我自己已经不太常玩这个游戏了，（无间难度的图对我来说还是比较难，不是很想花太多精力去思考了），但闲来无事打打每日挑战或随便开个几局，依然是相当不错的消遣，大概永远也不会厌倦吧。

31859057.review:
玩起來就感觉停不下來的遊戲！一开始觉得这个游戏有点像魔塔，真正玩上了之后发现，游戏里的要素比魔塔多的多。昨晚一接触，就停不下来直接通宵了。

大致讲讲现在的体验吧。
游戏分为[b]王国养成＋地下探险[/b]两个部分。
[h1]王国养成[/h1]主要就是利用探险赚取的金钱来升级建筑，以此解锁新种族、新职业和新道具。此外，还会发布任务和谜题，玩家可以从中赚取额外的金额。说真的游戏解谜也好有趣啊，而且有一定的难度，解出来之后非常有成就感！
[h1]地下探险[/h1]就是随机生成一张地图，玩家不断打怪升级最后打倒boss。虽然听起来很easy，实际上每一步都要经过计算，玩家需要合理的分配自己手里的资源。道具都很好但是背包有限[spoiler]权衡错误扔了重要道具导致后期无力ＧＧ[/spoiler]、越级打怪有额外经验但可能伤血较多[spoiler]血瓶磕完了等级再高也是等死[/spoiler]、信仰神祗会带来增益，然而不小心惹怒它道具就被全部清空[spoiler] 比如某个神就超讨厌玩家嗑血瓶，现在看到这个神就绕着走[/spoiler]。再加上开局不同的种族特性和职业特性，和不同特性的怪，游戏的可玩性非常高！
这款游戏可能更适合愿意动脑的玩家，从头莽到尾只会让你死的更快，特别是随着游戏进展要打的BOSS也越来越多的时候，步步为营是非常必要的。虽然说的这么困难，但这个游戏真的[b]超级有趣！[/b]，再加上它的[b]随机性[/b]和丰富的影响因素，[b]可玩性[/b]超级高！由于通过一张地图需要的时间不会超过２０分钟，完全可以在闲暇时间来上几局。相信喜欢它的玩家可以在它上面花费大量时间，考虑到这个游戏的价格，平摊到时间上其实还是非常划算的。

最后表白谜之声推荐了这么好玩的游戏！

感谢汉化组的辛勤工作和制作组的大力支持~
Thanks for the hard work of the group which provide the chinese localization and the support of QCF Design~

===

总体来说，是一个和符石守护者玩法比较类似的RoughLike游戏。
相比符石那么看脸，这款游戏或许更加看重技巧，或者该说它是披着RoughLike外壳的策略游戏。
只要按照一定的策略来进行游戏，一般来说不会出现被灭的情况（根据我前期的进度来看）

- 最好尝试越一到两级打怪，等级比较低的怪等到拿到石化后去石化，充分利用+50%经验的Buff
- 尽量充分利用好探开黑块时回的血和蓝，溢出得越少越好
- 先攻和火球都比较重要，开墙有时候会开出隐藏房间
- 最好是五六级以后再下地宫，不然可能会死在里面

总体来说，有着比较丰富的要素，有着一定的剧情推动，不会让人觉得刷刷刷太过无聊。
另外，这块游戏还有Android版，可以通过云同步存档。

30302747.review:
This is an absolutely great little game. The writing is cute and humorous, the music is fun and the gameplay itself is a combination of puzzle, mini-dungeon crawler and roguelike. It doesn't take itself too seriously but there is a lot of hidden depth in a seemingly simple idea. The addition of a daily dungeon and weekly reward gives more incentive to someone trying to build up their kingdom and there is always something to do.

The final sets of main quests are incredibly challenging but it's so very satisfying to finish one of them. One last thing I'll say that I really like about the game is that, aside from making silly mistakes or a situation of bad luck (both will happen sometimes), death feels like a learning experience. You now know what *not* to do. And each little dungeon dive is a short trip so its great when you want to play something but don't have a lot of time.

I have played this game a lot, not sure how long since I tend to leave DD up for hours while doing other things, come back, play a dungeon, and tab out again. I'd say 100 hours at the least, probably a lot more.

따라서 이 게임은 RPG보단 퍼즐에 가깝습니다. 독특하게도, 리플레이성이 뛰어난 퍼즐이죠. 혼자서 머리싸매고 고민하며 깨 나가는 재미가 아주 쏠쏠합니다. 다만, 게임 생긴게 이런지라 입문 장벽이 높고, 아는 사람만 아는 게임이라는 거죠... 혼자놀기용으로만 강추입니다.

29237078.review:
If you've never played Desktop Dungeons, play the Free Alpha. It's very accessible and very fun.
If you like the alpha, you will *probably* love the retail version, but there are so many caveats that I find it very hard to recommend.


1) There are a lot more items in the retail version of desktop dungeons, most of them feel rather balanced and fun to use.
    BUT unlocking these are barred behind dungeon completion quests and silver challenges, neither of which usually highlight the best aspects of Desktop Dungeons

2) Some of the dungeons are like mini-adventures or have very unique quirks that make them feel very different from other ones, and very challenging in their own way. The Alpha would have LOVED to have dungeons half as interesting.
   BUT the quests you are usually given and guided toward involve going to the most boring dungeons.

 Example: Namtar's Lair involves striking down a reanimating necromancer six times while carrying his corpse further and further down the Underworld, while you both become weaker the farther you descend. This dungeon is dope as hell, but there's no quests for it. Den of Danger is the resident baby dungeon and encourages you to replay it at least 11 times successfully (I think, AT LEAST 9). 

Verdict: This game is really fun and has a lot of content; however, the way you're encouraged to play to unlock things is not really the best showcase of the game. If you enjoy it and stick with it, there's a ton of fun you can have.

29212823.review:
A strategy rpg game where you explore random dungeons. Each time you enter a dungeon, the layout is different. The boss is fixed depending on the level you go in. A really neat thing is, even if you die, the stats of your character are listed at the end of the level.

I actually found this game hard due to it being very strategy dependent. For example, your level being very high can actually make the boss of a dungeon very hard, depending on which character class you play as. Add into this random weapons and magic on each dungeon, and a random god that gives you blessings depending on your spells and such, and you got a challenging rpg dungeon crawler.

Recommended just for it's difficulty playing it to give you a challenge.

Fun, simple, straightforward. Good time killer. Not a game with extreme depth, and not for everyone, but it delivers exactly what it claims: it's an oldschool desktop style game that reminds me in ways of "Yoda Stories" or "Chip's Challenge" but with more of a tactical side.

RNG can make some scenarios very hard to complete. Played it while I was sick and enjoyed it, but probably wouldn't take any time out of a full day to play it. That said, I can be hard to please. If you're not sure about this game, I believe there is a free version out there to try. If you're looking for something really straightforward to kill time with, this game is for you.

27970343.review:
You start each dungeon/puzzle at level 1 and have to fight your way through monsters until you can fight toe to toe with the boss. Despite being "puzzle-ish" there are a lot of different ways to beat a specific dungeon, even if it does not seem like it the first time you play. Fighting a monster takes away health and mana, though you can replenish it by exploring. However, just make sure to consider in which direction you want to explore the dungeon, as the precious tiles run out faster than you think. There are also a lot of different items that you can unlock, which will help you to smack those monsters around. And to spice it up, you have also 9 gods to choose from. Each one will alter your play style, as they reward and punish(!) various actions. One god is easy to learn, but tough to master, but to use more than one and know when to worship which god will take time, but will give such a huge reward!

In addition, there are some fixed dungeons included, which only allow for one single execution of steps to beat the challenge. They are very smartly designed and will teach you the mechanics of the game (if you are observant). Very well done!

10/10 Definitely recommend

Probably the smartest game I have played during the last couple of years.

This game is a puzzle game, that present a different challenge at every run, due to the random generation of the dungeons (dungeons layout, monsters, available items, spells, gods,...), the selection of the race and class of the adventurer and the preparation you bring into the dungeon. Each setup play very differently and regarding the huge amount of content available in it, there is literally several hundreds hours of gameplay in it.

What I like the most about it is that when you successfully finish a dungeon, you really feel like you have done a great achievement.

Highly recommended.

Desktop Dungeons is a very peculiar game which plays like some kind of puzzle game.
One half of the game you are buying upgrades in your town which will aid you in future adventures.
And the other half is you adventuring into caves and dungeons to slay the biggest baddest baddie available and return with the loot.
You are tossed out on a map which you explore square by square. Time standing still when you don't move.
Which gives the idea that you're supposed to stop and think for every move you make.
Resources are scarce, enemies aplenty. You have to decide which enemy to take down in which order and balance that with exploring and using potions and spells to your advantage.

27258441.review:
Desktop Dungeons is one of my favorite games.  The mix of roguelike and puzzle gameplay is extremely well-balanced to a satisfying difficulty combined with near-endless replayability.

You control a hero exploring a randomly-generated dungeon, gathering powerups, equipment, and spells (glyphs).  The enemies are purely reactive: they only damage you in retaliation to your attacks.  This mechanic sets Desktop Dungeons apart from most roguelikes, and your ability to plan ahead results in gameplay comparable to a puzzle game.  Situations can become increasingly complex as you progress further and obtain more unlockables (such as the various gods you can worship in the dungeon).

You (and the enemies) regenerate your health and mana through revealing unexplored tiles, allowing you to recharge between encounters.  Your resources are all finite, so you can't simply grind your way to victory.  Instead, careful play is needed to gain bonus XP from killing higher-level enemies without exhausting your ability to recover before you face the boss (or bosses).

The skill ceiling is extremely high, and the more difficult scenarios are quite brutal.  When you first start playing even the easier "Normal" dungeons will provide a challenge.  You can tilt the odds in your favor by spending kingdom gold (essentially your winnings from successful runs) on preparations that should make your hero more effective.   I will note that the most difficult dungeons are unnecessary to complete the main storyline, but beating them unlocks powerful items as well as four monster races. 

Dungeons are reasonably short (my runs are roughly 10-40 minutes depending on the situation), but the game is extremely replayable.  The wide selection of classes, races, and items allows for a wide diversity of viable builds.  I have played over a hundred hours and completed the main storyline, but it will be quite some time before I feel that I have exhausted the postgame content.  The Enhanced Edition additionally introduces a 'Daily Dungeon' feature allowing you to compare your results to other players.

You start at level 1 in a one screen dungeon, and try to get strong enough to beat the lvl 10 boss.
In the meantime, you will have to explore, get equipped, beat lower level foes to gain experience and get stronger.

The First time I ran into this game was years ago when it was a contender in the Independent Games Festival. I remember downloading other contest entries as well, but the alpha of this game was the one that really grabbed my attention. 

I spent hours upon hours playing the alpha and was really excited when I learned that they were making a full game out of it. I didn't buy the early access version, but I followed the development closely. 

When it finally was officially released I bought it immediately and boy was I surprised. I had expected a graphical overhaul and the extra features, but not to this extent! There was just so much more to unlock and do. The devs had upped everything to eleven. New monster types, afflictions, gods, character classes, races, secrets, challenge dungeons, tutorials, the list just goes on and on.

The full release really pushed this game to new heights, at least for me. What had been a quick puzzle fix was now a fully fleshed out puzzle game with a mischievious art style and depth like never before + the ost by Danny Baranowsky and Grant Kirkhope is great!

26872345.review:
TLDR: If you're into logic/puzzles, math, and rogue-like elements, the games don't get more entertaining than this.  

The Good: 
-The necessity to use different strategies and builds depending on the levels. There's no single strategy that will beat the game for you.
-The difficulty is almost spot-on throughout the entire game. It's only easy in the beginning. By the end it's brutally hard, but you feel accomplished.
-Fun in small spurts or for long periods of time.
-There are a ton of upgrades that keep the game fresh.

The Bad:
-The more you lose on one level the harder it is to remain patient and play well (more of a personal flaw, but it applies greatly here).
-The randomness of the "boss", glyph drops, enemies, etc. can break/ruin a run for you.  Takes some luck on harder levels.

Verdict: If you can deal with feeling dumb as you try to figure out the best strategies and are patient enough to not blow a fuse as you repeat levels multiple times, the game is great.  The upgrades keep the game and strategies fresh and you feel great accomplishment as you make your way through the harder levels.  For the price they are asking, you get great value for your buck.  I'd give it a solid 9/10.

Все представленные в игре классы и расы персонажей можно комбинировать (кроме особых классов монстров), получая огромное количество разных сочетаний, каждый со своим определенным стилем и стратегией. Разумеется какие-то варианты сочетаются лучше, какие-то хуже, но в целом выбор довольно большой. От того игра очень реиграбельна и увлекательна.
Попробовать поиграть определенно стоит, разочарованных будет мало. 

Однако, после определенного момента игра становится несправедливо сложной, даже не давая разблокировать весь доступный контент, чтобы его опробовать (видимо, это своего рода, награда только для избранных). Этим и отпугивает и заставляет на себя забивать. Потому как мало того, что просто не можешь пройти данж, так еще и ресурсов на это начинаешь тратить больше чем зарабатываешь.
Собственно, когда игрок проходит все данжи среднего уровня сложности и часть данжей высокого уровня, то перед ним ставят как бы конкретный выбор:
- Либо играть просто чисто на интерес время от времени с тем, что успел разблокировать.
- Либо учиться играть как отец, чтобы позволить себе углубиться дальше в игру и разблокировать новый контент: новые данжи, классы и постройки.

От себя, честно, мне игра понравилась, но не на столько, чтобы хотеть быть в ней лучше и тратить на это время. Но одновременно с тем становится досадно, от того что не хватает навыков для того, чтобы разблокировать хотя бы новые классы для того чтобы временами просто чисто развлечься.

26381495.review:
I think the main reason I didn't really like Desktop Dungeons is that it is not at all what I expected. I thought this game was going to be a rogue-like dungeon-crawler rpg, but after a few hours of play I realized that the game simply isn't this at all. It is actually an rpg skin over top of a resource optimization puzzle game. The dungeons aren't really about battles, equipment, or spells (though all these things are in the game), they are about whether you can exploit the idiosynchrasies of the game mechanics to squeeze a few extra xp out of the dungeon so that you can ultimately beat the boss.

Let me explain: There's a limited (and small) number of enemies in each dungeon, as well as a limited amount of gold and healing. You start at level 1. The boss is at level 10. You've got to level your character up and accumulate stuff to have any chance against the boss. But here's the rub: if you simply kill the enemies in order from lowest level to highest, you don't stand much chance. You need to take advantage of the battle mechanics to kill higher level monsters than you really should be able to in sneaky, gamey ways. Then, you'll get bonus experience and reach a higher level faster. Hence, the whole game becomes a puzzle of how you can squeeze all the resources out of a limited supply. This kind of puzzle is just not what I signed up for, and I found playing this way to be very effective but very tedious and dull.

If you are looking for a puzzle game combined with rpg elements, you might like this. Otherwise, I'd skip it.

26064187.review:
I've been playing Desktop Dungeons since the alpha, signed up during the beta, happily redeemed my key on Steam and have put in countless hours. It's genuinely one of the best puzzle games ever made - it has a roguelike sheen and borrows heavily from Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup (which is my roguelike of choice anyways) but it follows a certain iterative structure, and builds into something that requires a lot of math, resource management, and long-term thinking with short-term heuristics on trying to figure out the best choice when you don't have all of the information in front of you. It's genuinely good, more than well worth the price point, and I'd suggest it to anybody who asked and try to push it on a few people who didn't either.

Don't go in expecting a formal RPG - it does get hard, fast, but it's much much more forgiving than it seems, and while the learning curve is steep, it pulls you right up along it. I would only refrain from recommending it if you're looking for not even a more casual experience, but just something that doesn't require you to do a weird amount of math on the fly. Otherwise, it's a game that could happily belong in everyone's library.

24265127.review:
Let me preface this by saying; this was the first game that actually got me interested in the genre of Rogue-likes. Previously I had played around with Vulture for Nethack, The Binding of Isaac (although it doesn’t necessarily fit my idea of Rogue-like), Don’t Starve, and some various flash games that just never sparked interest. 

Now here is what Desktop Dungeons does right
- Great for beginners:
If you're willing to waltz throught the tutorial, which I recommend you do, you'll begin to believe that you understand the game a lot more than you do, but the tutorial drops you off at a point where the learning curve is much less steep.

- Captivating and Hilarious:
Each of the missions that you run through, each have taken me around 3-5 runs before completion, have left me thirsty for much much more, and considering the expandability of your kingdom and the available upgrades, I believe I haven't even sank my teeth into the first quarter of this game and I love it. Going back to the tutorial,  the narrator is hilarious and there are always little things they add into the game that make me giggle. Never a full on guffaw, but a solid giggle. 

- Difficulty:
Beyond giggling to the moon at the minor jokes that are at hand, Desktop Dungeons has set an immense level of difficulty, which parallels its learning curve. If the dungeon begin to feel too easy for you, go ahead and try out the puzzles up the mountain, I promise it won't be at all a cake walk. The puzzles really make you go indepth with the mechanics of the game and how each item affects how your character attacks.


And here is what I think has gone wrong (only one thing)
 - Price:
I don't believe the price point is necessarily a fair one. The only reason I have this game now, is because I got it in a humble bundle, which is still going on until 7/12/16 where I paid a little over half for this game, and plenty of others, rather than its full price. I don't think I would have bought it otherwise, but I believe if you're on the fence about buying it, you absolutely should.

23940359.review:
I played a ton of Desktop Dungeons back in college, when it was a freeware game. It had everything I loved most about roguelikes - the balance between short-term tactics and long-term strategy, resource management, and replayability. Then it put all that into a puzzle sort of format that made it easy to learn and quick to play whenever I had some time between classes. Best of all, it was designed such the RNG had little influence on your outcome. Your victories, and your failures, were your own.

This release maintains the solid gameplay and tight balance of the original, while adding a metric ton of content. There are so many dungeons, monsters, races, classes, gods, and so on now that even I'm overwhelmed. Fortunately, it's meted out to you in a very mobile-game sort of way, which in any other game I'd find distasteful. If anything, I'd say the pace of content unlocking is almost too fast. I'm unlocking way more things than I can try even once. 

Desktop Dungeons is well worth your money and time. After watching the gameplay videos I wasn't convinced they had done enough to turn this freeware classic into a $15 product, but now that I've played it (for 6 hours straight, glued to my chair) I can confidently recommend it.

지금까지 구매한 스팀 게임중 잴 재밌게 한 게임 세개만 고르라고 하면 데스크탑 던전이 그 중 하나로 무조건 들어갈 것. 커피 브레이크 게임이라고 하여, 한판에 십여분 정도로 짧게 할 수 있는 퍼즐 게임이다. 하지만 스테이지 클리어를 목표로 한다면 플레이 타임은 쭉~ 늘어나게 된다.

난이도가 노-브레인 플레이가 가능할 정도의 게임은 아닌 것이, 초반 튜토리얼이 끝나고 처음 시작하는 판부터도 비효율적인 움직임을 한다면 클리어하기가 쉽지 않다고 느낄 것. 배우긴 쉽고, 마스터하긴 어려운 게임이라고 생각한다, 사실 굉장히 어렵다고 느꼈다.

몇가지 유용한 전략들을 알아두고 플레이하는 것이 좋고, 아카데미에서 각종 전략을 튜토리얼로 제공하는데 보상도 있고 내용도 매우 유익한 편이므로 테크닉을 익혀두는 편이 좋다.

그냥 모든 맵을 언락/클리어, 모든 직업은 언락하는 정도만 했는데도 플레이 타임이 90시간이 넘었다. 아이패드에서 즐겼던 것까지 포함한다면 더 늘어났을 것. 굉장히 재밌는 게임이다, 더 파고 들고 싶다면 Vicious 토큰을 이용해 더 어렵게 플레이 할 수 있는 모드 까지 존재한다;

한마디로 표현하자면 지뢰찾기 + 로그라이크 라고 볼 수 있겠다. 자원을 얼마나 효율적으로, 전략적으로 사용하는지가 중요한 게임.

DD seems like a really excellent base engine for some game-changing DLC or a very interesting sequel.

20889611.review:
I acutally wouldn't consider this game a roguelike. While it does have the trappings of one, such as leveling, equipment, classes, gods, etc. it plays more like a puzzle game. 

You enter a one-screen (sometimes with a basement) dungoen with one or more bosses hiding in it. Your objective is to kill all the bosses. However, you will have to level up your character enough in order to be able to stand a chance against the boss. You do this by defeating lesser enemies in a logical order, using your class and racial abilities. Enemies don't move, so you have plenty of freedom to think out your moves. Strangely enough, you gain HP and mana by exploring the dark areas of the screen, so you'll have to manage this resource carefully.

Overall, this game fits the bill for those who like puzzles, but also enjoy random elements and roguelikes or rpgs. Don't expect an exploration-based experience, though.

Не помню точно, когда впервые начал играть в DD, где-то пару лет назад, случайно наткнулся в сети. Было очень сложно. Я с трудом выигрывал Hard данжи, причём чисто случайно, абсолютно не понимая как. Бросил.
Года полтора назад вспомнил о них и тут уже мне покорились Vicious данжи, но не полностью, например, я никак не мог сделать Purist в Naga City. Забросил на полгода.
И вот с год назад я засел за неё — ещё пиратскую версию — и никак не могу оторваться.
Эта игра поистине гениальна. 
Это шедевр. 
Идеальный баланс. 
Захватывающий и непредсказуемый геймплей. 
Практически неисчерпаемая реиграбельность, за счёт многообразия рас, классов, предметов, богов, глифов (заклинаний), монстров, подземелий, и в конце концов просто рандома, который может как превратить Normal данж в нереальный хардкор, так и сделать Vicious беззаботной прогулкой. А ещё можно придумывать свои собственные стратегии и тактики, комбинируя всё это как угодно.
(Ну да, сейчас я прошёл её полностью, начал заново, прошёл где-то на 40% и что-то во мне перегорело, я реально шпилил сутками дней 10 в неё, и сейчас как-то не хочу больше.)
Само то, как ты начинаешь играть и раз за разом помираешь, постепенно учишься и спустя (немалое) время постигаешь все (как бы не так) тонкости этой игры, познаешь дзен Desktop Dungeons, так сказать — потрясающе, выше всяких похвал. Может, я не так уж много игр в своей жизни перепробовал, но пока что эта лучшая. И я считаю, что каждый должен поиграть в неё. Кроме того, по моему скромному мнению, игра весьма интеллектуальна и способствует развитию ума, ну или как минимум поддержанию формы. Всё же это рогалик только с виду, а на деле скорее головоломка.
Изумительная игра.

A great rogue-like rpg/puzzle hybrid with hours of gameplay value.

Pros:
+ Artwork: All functioning, no roughness, all easy on the eye
+ Soundtrack: Even its short, repetition doesnt bore you
+ Gameplay: Every dungeon is a puzzling challenge. Solving something always rewards. Many progression aspects for further gameplay.
+ Mechanics: Everything works as it is meant to be. Didnt encounter any bugs. Puzzle system is superb!

Cons:
- Sometimes a randomly generated dungeon might be too hard or impossible to solve. (Even tho' you can exit the dungeon forehand and carry your earnings, even losing is rewarding.)
- Even the game is cool and all, i find its price a little bit much.


If you want a good puzzle game (with rpg-roguelike spice on it), this is the game for you. Dont miss this one.

20479623.review:
Should you play Desktop Dungeons?

Desktop Dungeons is a rogue-like turn based RPG that plays out perfectly. Definitely a one-of a kind. Honestly, the game is fun, strategic and has received a lot of acclaim and approval from the gaming community. But getting past that, is it really a game you want to play? You start out as a Human Fighter trying to beat dungeons, steal their loot, all for the rightful mission of building your own cities. On the way, you meet fearsome monsters and plots that could end your city..Or fund your wealth. A lot of story-telling is involved, for example, you can even call forth the power of the ancient deities to aid you in your quest, or make a Pact with another to become more resilient. There are a lot of customization and combinations one can try to beat the levels. 

This game is definitely worth its price. If you doubt my words but still want to give this game a whirl, you can always wait for it to go on sale, then give it a try.

Should you play Desktop Dungeons? Yes, you should definitely play it.

Highly recommended for anyone with masochistic tendancies.

19588886.review:
Las pantallas suelen durar unos 30 min max, dependiendo de lo que tardemos en tomar las decisiones.

La curva de aprendizaje es algo elevada, alguna mecanica es un poco dificil de entender de inicio, pero si consigues saltar esa valla es un juego muy adictivo y con muchisimo contenido, se ve que hay mucho mimo puesto en el, incluso han ido añadiendo mucho contenido de forma gratuita a un ya de por si extensisimo juego.

Como las pantallas se generan aleatorias, la suerte tambien juega un papel importante, pero no suele ser determinante, ya que siempre hay varias estrategias, y formas de hacer las pantallas. Eso si preparaos para sudar la gota gorda en las patallas finales, es un juego en el que yo creo que leer alguna guia de iniciacion se agradece.

Hay 3 mecanicas fundamentales que hay que entender cuando antes mejor, la primera es que nos curaremos y llenaremos el mana al descubrir las zonas negras del mapa, esto es algo vital para ir limpiando de enemigos la pantalla.

La segunda cosa es que al subir de nivel las barras de vida y mana se llenan.

Y la tercera es que matar enemigos de mas nivel nos aporta mas experiencia, la mejor estrategia es siempre intentar matar enemigos de almenos 1 nivel superior, a mas nivel mejor,  y cuando necesitemos curarnos rematemos a los de nivel bajo que tengamos repartidos por la pantalla, moriran de 1 golpe, y si somos capaces de dominar cuando subimos de nivel el juego cambia por completo, ya que esta diseñado con estas premisas en mente.

En definitiva un juego totalmente recomendable,que nos hara darle al coco muchisimas horas, y del que dificilmente te cansas, ya que su aleatoriedad lo hace muy rejugable.

19535334.review:
Ett av de bästa spelen jag spelat.

Rouge like, som kan hjälpa dig slå ihjäl de där 15 minuterna, om du bara vill strö spela lite.

Eller kräva en 45 minuter för att försöka ta dig genom de lite svårare banorna, speciellt när du kör med restriktioner för att få de där utmärkelserna.

Du spelar olika hjältar, människor, gnomer, dvärgar mfl. Välj din klass krigare kanske en magiker eller tjuv.

Välj de karaktärer som gör banorna lättare eller välj de som inte passar just den banan för mer utmaning.

Till att börja med kan du välja människokrigare och du spelar en bana i taget och var gång börjar du i level 1 på din karaktär och ska försöka klara av banans boss. Oavsätt om du dör eller lyckas så börjar du en helt ny omgång nästa gång.
Men det finns möjligheter att låsa upp mer raser och klasser (yrken) för dina äventyrare. Även andra föremål och saker som kan vara till hjälp kommer låsas upp med tiden.

Detta är ett pusselspel där det gäller att välja sina start förutsättningar och utnyttja sina resurser till rikligt bra för att vinna mot banans boss.

IOM att du låser upp saker ger det en progression och det slump artade sätt som var bana skapas med vissa regler och special varianter för de olika bantyperna ger väldigt mycket åter spelbarhet.

Jag skulle rekommendera detta till alla som gillar pussel spel, resurs optimering, rougelikes eller något att bara slå ihjäl en kaffe paus med.

19513902.review:
I have been playing this on a Linux Ubuntu 14.04 laptop plugged into the big living room TV.  It goes full screen no problem but the graphics are in 4:3 so it has the black borders on the side.  Some say the game has bad graphics and I am not sure why.  I have seen games with way more pixelation where everyone is talking about how great it is.  To me what matters is, are the graphics pleasing to look at? With this game, I say yes.  It has a nice overall look.

It took me awhile to warm up to this, but I love this game.  It is a great turn based strategy gem.  It appears to be a RPG dungeon crawl but it is not.  Dungeons are solitary one floor puzzles.  Each time you start with a level one dude. The money  you earn lets you upgrade your town which gives you more dudes and starting buffs to choose from.  So it is RPG-ish but not much.  It is pretty challenging but totally doable.  Highly recommended.

19363473.review:
I'm kind of torn on this game.  It's obviously well done and gets great reviews.  That said, I don't enjoy it very much.  I was looking for a game that could I could play quickly on the go or as in between other games and based on the reviews, this seemed to be it.  

I've played around 15 hours now, and just don't enjoy it that much.  If you like rogue-like puzzlers then it's probably a good game for you.  For me, it just lacks that balance between depth of gameplay and casual mental involvement.  If you approach this game casually, you'll almost certainly never win (other then the few introductory games); and if you approach it to  win, then it's certainly neither casual.

I also found the depth of gameplay everyone talks about to be a bit lacking.  After getting frustrated, unable to beat even the first "normal" dungeons, I read a couple of the brief introductory help guides on the community page.  Yes, there are some nuances around skills and abilities, but once you get the "always kill monsters higher level than yourself", that's about 90% of what you need to understand and succeed in this game.

Is there skill involved in this game?  Absolutely.  Is it well done?  Yes.  Could it be a nice, quick diversion or an entire Friday night's gaming session?  Totally.  Is it for me - no.  I feel bad giving this game a thumbs down, and it feels like I'm totally mission something, but for me it just isn't there.  I am compelled to play it from time to time - but unfortunately just in that compulsive "gotta get the next upgrade" kind of way, not the good "OMG I can't wait to play Desktop Dungeons" kins of way.

Great Rogue/Puzzle adventure!

More Puzzle than roguelike but attention to detail at it's finest.  Mash strat, stat and items to overcome evil all the while managing your health, mana and survival.  Begins easy but comes on strong and really gives you that 'Atta Boy' feeling when you've completed a new level.  Many ingame achievements such as winning without use of healing or mana pots, using only physical or magical damage, won the round with each of the various classes, etc.

I keeps you going that's for sure but the difficulty ramps up the farther you go and unlocking new classes, abilities and powers for your Mage, Thief, Fighter and Priest (to start) which should hold most of the 'genre' to a good long while.

I had played the free version for awhile prior to the purchase of the retail so I'm hoping to get more time in it amongst the other dozen or so of things I need to get back too (lol, gamer ADD am right?!) but it's nice to play a round at lunch or while on an important conference call for work (note, please do not impact your work productivity on a game; that's foolish.. OR IS IT?) 

Regardless, love the idea, design and playability on this one and I hope you do too!
~Icky

17144531.review:
Desktop Dungeons is an entertaining indie game that combines a variety of aspects from RPG, strategy, and puzzle games.  As the ruler of a kingdom, you construct buildings and recruit heroes to do your bidding for you.  The buildings themselves offer unique perks to improve the efficiency of your kingdom while you take control of a hero as you send them out into the further reaches of your lands on quests.

Each quest that you undertake is an entire adventure in itself.  Your hero starts at level 1 and you are capable of leveling them all the way to level 10 during the course of the map.  Each level drastically improves the capabilities of your character and there are plenty of beneficial boosts and magical items to find along the way.

Your buildings, on the other hand, offer options such as crafting magical gear, unlocking one of the many unique classes, adding additional boosts and content to encounter on your adventures, and even new races - all of which have their own stats that significantly alter the playstyle of -every- class.

The quests themselves are turn-based and give you all the time you need to execute the strategy of your choice.  You'll have to manage your health, mana, and experience as you try to maximize your gains and minimize your losses.  The game is unforgiving, though, very rewarding when you successfully pull off a dungeon and drag home a mountain of treasure.

I recommend this game to fans of turn-based RPGs, fantasy worlds, and strategy/puzzle gamers.  I found it to be far more enjoyable than I was expecting.  If you're on the fence, give it a try!

17132599.review:
I really like the idea of this game, and I even like the game itself, for the most part, but I cannot recommend it.
The learning curve is deceptively shallow until you pass the Easy dungeon. Then, it gets steep quickly.
I haven't decided if the problem is the procedurally generated levels (meaning you can't figure out the right path and then execute it properly on the second run, if you didn't manage it the first time), or if the problem is the tricks you can use to beat things beyond your normal abilities (an expectation that once you've encountered an ability, you'll be able to put it in practice like a seasoned rules lawyer).
Either way, the Normal dungeons are all too difficult for me, even after several runs at trying to solve them.
The result, however, is this: far from being a fun and quirky game you can use to fill ten minutes for a break from your work, it becomes a frustrating problem that has players spending much longer than intended trying to beat a dungeon, any dungeon, before giving up in furstration.
Great idea, lousy execution.

16118874.review:
这么好的游戏竟然没有中文评测……
其实以前就听说过桌面地下城的游戏了，但是一直拖着也没太留意，上次打折朋友送了我~超感谢的~

首先这游戏肯定玩盗版的人多，因为目前汉化跟不上正版的版本，英文应该卡住很多人了。不过其实从初步玩5小时的感受来说，用词不难的，熟悉地牢类的看个大概就能明白意思了，真有需要的，百度一下就能查到。如果你对这个游戏有兴趣，千万不要被语言绊住，看不懂略过就好了，为此错过它真的很可惜。很神奇的一件事是，在哪这游戏都不会显得人气有多高，帖子数不多，资源也很少，但是几乎有什么具体的问题，或者谜题解不出来，加上具体关键词就能搜出解法……都是一波沉默的真爱……
其次特别要称赞桌面地下城的一点就是，它对新手非常亲和，上手极其简单，玩到现在都感觉不到什么难度，而是还在缓慢地铺开它极其丰富的元素中~估计难度到后面才起来（但puzzle一开始就很考脑子就是了，用这种方式让玩家必须弄懂某些东西的正确用法），在网上还是看到有关难度的讨论的。而且别看它长得像roguelike，其实玩法挺轻松的，只是一个一个十来分钟一趟的小地牢，失误了restart就好，没有一般roguelike的苛刻和压迫感。比起roguelike，解谜的元素可能还重一点，因为很多时候你要考虑的其实是怎么走才能最大化经验、最大化利用回血回蓝等等，或者说是一种策略性吧，需要构思如何在有限的资源里成功把角色培养得能顺利推倒boss。很偶尔的，不小心碾压了boss的时候~超！爽！
再次就是这款游戏元素的丰富性了，roguelike和策略不再提，它还涉及一点经营养成——建设经营你的王国，在地牢里养成你的一命英雄；地牢和闯关——每打通一个地牢，结尾的统计都会让人很有成就感，不但会以图标形式重现你的砍怪之路，还有一堆的badges等着成就党；RPG与种族、职业之争——剧情总是蛮喜感的，丰富的种族和职业特性则带来更多的自由度；到了后期（目前我还没玩到），除了各种技能和道具可以钻研以外，还有信仰、装备、职业挑战……应有尽有。别的暂时还没想到，反正光这几点就很诱人了~
然后就是一些零零碎碎的闪光点，比如官方很喜欢卖萌但其实超贱啦、BGM很可爱啦、啰嗦的执政官神烦啦、明明美起来很美帅起来超俊然而制作组还是喜欢画一些歪瓜裂枣啦、越级打怪才是王道定律啦、小学数学不学好会作死啦……等等等等，总而言之就是特别讨喜的那种游戏。

游戏目前已经很成熟，缺的只是耐得下心的玩家。如果这是你的口味，那么桌面地下城一定会让你足够喜欢，因为它已经做到了没有缺点。10/10

暂时就想到这么多，以后有机会的话可能会补充下。

15903015.review:
The deep strategy, clever tongue-n-cheek writing, and the challenging difficulty make this game a must play for anyone a fan of fantasy/RPG or puzzle/strategy games. Unlocking all the races and classes is very fun, and trying out new missions and strategies is a real challenge. I laughed aloud more than once, and the illustrations and music are both highly entertaining. Overall, this is a well made game.

I will say that, as a new player of puzzle/strategy games, this one is a bit over my head at times. Perhaps I'm just not good enough, but I found myself dying a lot in the later game. And, honestly, I doubt I'll ever "beat" it. It becomes very difficult. But, if you like that challenge, go for it. Deaths aren't cheap; they're earned--easily earned, but earned none the less. No cheap deaths here.

All in all, this one was a surprise for me, and I love it. Give it a shot!

15889413.review:
I remember being in awe of the game innovation. 

Your enemies are numbered between lvls 1-10. 
You start as a level 1 and have to fight them.
Each one is worth xp, the higher the kill - the higher the xp.
Weapons, spells and strategy are needed to eliminate them. 

Starts simple, develops complexity as you go.

Your health and mana regenerate from exploring the darkness.
You unlock new races, gods and classes with quests and gold.
The game structure has solid early, mid and late game content.

The difficulty ramps up as you go - the wikipage and forum have solid tips and guides.

Graphics and movement are neat.
Mouse and keyboard with shortcut keys.
I have spent hundreds of hours playing Desktop Dungeons.
It's definately worth playing!

15807969.review:
Overall: Good

Likes:
- innovative game mechanic where unexplored tiles are used as a resource -- uncovering tiles is the primary way to heal and regain mana, but damaged enemies are also healed.  You have to strike a balance between exploring to discover items and enemies, and saving exploration for when you need to regen.
- strategic gameplay that is somewhat puzzle-y
- has puzzle levels
- has daily challenges
- a lot of things (classes, enemies, items, upgrades, etc) to unlock

Dislikes:
- once you get the hang of the basic strategy, you pretty much just apply it to every level.  It is still fun, but I wish there were more strategies.

15754727.review:
Desktop Dungeons is a turn based roguelike with a little bit of a difference; each run in a dungeon takes about five minutes to come to conclusion. You are free to roam around the dungeon as much as you want, enemies will only attack you if you attack them first, giving you the freedom to work out your strategy however you prefer. 

Graphics are the usual 2d style which we are seeing so much of these days, but the sprites are nicely designed with some well-known characters thrown in there such as Super Meat Boy. The UI can be a little daunting to begin with but you see all of the information you require within one click. 

Each of the individual levels are randomly generated; this adds to the replayability of the game as no dungeon will ever be the same; I believe each dungeon has its own set "theme" but what is included in the dungeon and how its laid out is completely random. The difficulty is something to be said for though, it is very easy to learn how to play, but very difficult to master, you will die, ALOT in Desktop Dungeons, they even tell you that at the very beginning of the game; it is to be expected. It takes a lot of thought out planning and preparation to work your way through most of the dungeons even straight after the tutorial you are thrown straight in at the deep end. 

The game length can vary, I have been playing for about five hours and I still haven’t managed to get past the fifth dungeon, there are tons of content available, class challenges, random dungeon runs, extra tutorial lessons for different spells and many more. I have seen some people with over a hundred hours put into Desktop Dungeon. One of the extra plus points I've found is that a potato can run this game, meaning you can stick it on any machine, maybe even your work machine, and load it up on breaks to sneak in fifteen minutes here and there; as it's not resourcefully demanding. 

Desktop Dungeons is certainly worth your time, and boy will it suck up your time as it is highly addictive.

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up. You can also find more reviews over at http://www.completingthebackloggroup.com/

http://store.steampowered.com/app/226620

15748187.review:
I started playing the free version of the game and finally got the steam version. That was a really good choice. My advice: Try the free version, it'll show you the very core of the game. If you like it get the full version.

Pros:

- Problems to solve strategically: Essentially every dungeon is different and you can solve it in many different ways. But, one or two mistakes and you're done. This is the rogue-like aspect of the game. In the start you'll feel very lost but as soon as you play you'll start using the deep mechanics of the game in your advantage.

- Progression and goals to be achieved. Development of your kingdom and uncovering different races, classes, items, etc. through the campaign mode. This is the hook of the game, the RPG aspect, and the way it's done is fantastic.

- Huge replayability. The amount of combinations is just enormous. It's always the same idea: get in the dungeon, kill the boss/es and get out, but the amount of combinations of classes, races, deities, items, layout of the dungeon, level of difficulty of the dungeon, badges achievable, etc make every run different than the previous one.

- Daily dungeon.

- Complex and difficult. This game is all about thinking, the puzzle element is about 70% of the game. I you don't like staring at the screen for a couple of minutes checking your best option then you probably won't like the game. Difficult dungeons take about 20-30 min and you need to be focus all the time.

- Good difficulty curve and very good tutorials.



Cons:

- Can't think of any. 



Overall this is an extremely well done game (once you play for a while you'll notice this in the little details). Very original and unique in its way. But remember to try the free version first, this is not a game for everyone.

15675123.review:
Desktop Dungeons is an extremely addictive roguelike strategy game where each randomly generated dungeon is, essentially, a puzzle to be solved. 

It is easy to pick up and play but there is also a great deal to learn and lots of game mechanics to master. 

The short length of each dungeon run means that it is a great game to dip in and out of but you can also play for longer periods of time. There is a longer-term aspect to the game as you unlock new options such as races, classes, challenges and quests.

Different dungeons along with the various race and class choices provide new challenges and the player is often required to update or alter their strategic thinking in order to be successful. This keeps the game fresh and engaging.

Desktop Dungeons has a lot of different race and class combinations plus many different types of dungeons and challenges. There is a high level of replay value and it is a game that you could easily play for hundreds of hours.

I feel that it is a really well made game. The soundtrack, in particular, is excellent. There is also lots of replayability here. I feel that Desktop Dungeons offers excellent value for money and it is well worth picking up if you enjoy this style of game.

15665644.review:
I cannot recommend this game at this time.  It is -not- pick up and play as mentioned on the page, and dungeons can not be finished in 5-10 minutes unless you are an expert at the game and know all the strategies.  The fact I had to reference a strategy guide during the tutorials repeatedly was a big warning sign.

As it stands I've barely made it past getting the banker, and I've spent the last four hours trying and failing to finish any dungeon at all.  The game is beyond difficult.  If you aren't willing to sit down and do some number crunching and brain math, don't waste your time.  This is not a casual, low-input game you can fluff through.  

I'm going to try sticking it out a bit, see if maybe something clicks and the game gets easier, but it's getting lower and lower on my priority list and will probably end up in my 'waste of time and money' list.

It's a shame, because I enjoyed the premise, and it certainly seemed cool on the surface.  I just didn't realize I was in for Dark Souls the Puzzle Game minus the part where keeping your nose to the grindstone eventually results in progress.

I've completely beaten the original Desktop Dungeons, which is a wonderful, wonderful free game. This new version is a complete b4stardization of the original.

In the original, I could unlock new characters and races by completing certain challenges. Simple and clean.

In this version, I have to purchase upgrades scattered across various parts of the town map and play levels over and over again to collect gold to unlock things. It's as tedious as playing a pay to win game with in-app purchases. Instead of being a puzzle/rouge-like game, it's now a repetitive RPG. 15529814.review:
Nice puzzle game, in dungeon crawler RPG form. 

You start each dungeon at level 1, and the goal is to power up enough to kill the boss. But you have limited resources. You only heal by exploring unexplored tiles or leveling up (or chugging potions), and you only level up by killing things (which usually depletes health and/or mana). And monsters and items don't respawn or anything like that. So you have to be smart about how you go about killing things, and in what order, and so on.

You can also unlock new classes and starter items and such to take into the various dungeons, and there are special challenge dungeons, and some tightly calibrated puzzle levels. It's pretty engaging overall. Made me late to class because I lost track of time.

Also the music in the dungeons is pretty great. 

And the tutorial system is extremely well done. It throws you right into a dungeon that's designed to teach you how to play as you go, without any explicit instructions. And then once you complete it (or, I bet, if you die), it gives you the option to continue on to the rest of the game or to go into some actual hand-holding tutorial levels with explicit instruction.

15517359.review:
This review is mostly for people unfamiliar with Desktop Dungeons. If you played the free alpha, then you already know whether you like the game; this new version features many improvements, but it's still the same type of gameplay.

Anyway, the second video (with the gnome wizard runthrough) does a decent job of showcasing game mechanics. Your goal is to explore a randomly-generated dungeon and ultimately to defeat a high-level boss monster. To beat the boss, you'll need to have leveled efficiently. This (usually) includes killing the highest-level monster that you can at any given time, since you get bonus XP for killing a monster whose level is higher than your own. 

That's pretty much the core of what makes Desktop Dungeons interesting: you're always trying to beat a tougher monster. The way you do this varies tremendously; there's a long list of things that can help or hurt you, and you have to deal with whichever ones happen to be in the dungeon you're exploring. It's this variation that keeps the game interesting hours later.

Bottom line: I don't often write reviews. I like Desktop Dungeons enough that I felt I should take the time. I highly recommend this game.

15481690.review:
Desktop Dungeons is a good game for what it is. I played free variant for a long time, before picking up this  release.

The released version adds more of everything, more monsters, spells, classes, quests, rewards ...
This version also has upgraded graphic, making everything more charming.

Game play is turn based, with monster being stationary (some bosses have blink spell, that moves them unless you counter it.). At the beginning dungeon has fog of war. You reveal parts of dungeon by moving to adjacent square. You want to be carefull how much of a dungeon you reveal, since each square you reveal, recovers some of you health and mana. This is the main way you will recover health and mana. This means that exploring too much too early can leave you unable to heal, later on. On the other hand each square you reveal can have beneficial items, that you might want. This makes unrevealed tiles in dungeon weary important resource.

This is a quick game. Once you get used to controls and basic concepts, you can easily complete a dungeon/quest in 5 min. If it will take you longer it will be because you spend time thinking of best move.

Game is also paced quite well, so at the beginning you only have access to one class and one race (human fighter.), but you quickly unlock more.

With all that said, it is important to remember that this game is a filler game. It's meant to be played in short sessions.
If you play it for hours, you will quickly become bored. But playing couple of dungeons every day, while waiting for whatever bigger game you are currently playing to patch itself, it is time well spent.

15477290.review:
Desktop Dungeons is a puzzle game that takes elements from rogue and condenses it to a single screen experience. You pick a class, buy some starting items and venture forth into a randomly generated dungeon. Your "hero" always starts at level 1 and you have to find a way to make the best use of experience boosts, glyphs, items and gold to beat the boss (or bosses) of the level. If you're successful you bring back treasures that will help improve your kingdom and allow you to discover new dungeons and monsters.

The goal is to use your resources to beat higher level monsters and get the experience boost you need to level up high enough to strike the boss. Uncovered tiles regenerate you and your foes, so waste as little as possible. Keep weak monsters around to strategically level up mid-fight and gain a full heal. There are lots of strategies and once you master them you can tackle any dungeon with any class. The mechanics are very deep and the advanced dungeons can take you one or two hours to beat them. Some later dungeons also abandon the idea of a single screen map and will offer two or more screens to play with, or challenge you with shifting walls. There's even a minotaur that chases you.

I've been playing the game since beta and there's still more content for me to uncover. The newly added daily challenges adds new motivation to keep playing the game and the absolutely fantastic soundtrack by Danny Baranowsky has been a steady part of my music playlist since release. If you like puzzles and you like strategical fights then this game is a must buy.

14517086.review:
Like most adults who work for a living, I have very hard limits on what I am willing to spend on particular items. Take a bottle of wine, for example: I've found that there is no difference between a ten dollar bottle of wine and a thirty dollar bottle of wine. Anybody that tells you otherwise is trying to impress you. With wine, you get very little return on your investment past the 15-20 dollar price point. There's a reason that many sommeliers refuse to do blind tastings, and that reason being that sommeliers have all agreed to subscribe to the same groupthink that says X vintage and Y grapes grown in Z reason are superior, and none of this information would be available to them if they were prevented from looking at the label on the bottle. Have you ever met anyone who's a certified "master sommelier"? They're truly insufferable people. The next time you meet one ask them a question about wine - any question, it doesn't matter how dumb, will send them into a desperate panic while they fumble to form an opinion, any opinion, about the matter in question. It doesn't matter what their answer is becuase they will be certain to couch it in arcane wine terms like "tannins" and "finish" and other completely subjective abstract concepts that you won't understand.

Desktop Dungeons is like an overpriced bottle of wine. Sure, the label is fancy and the guy trying to sell it to you is telling you about how great it is, using words like "replayability" and other nonsense, but as soon as you taste it you realize "hey, this tastes just like a $5 iphone game?"

Just look at the screenshots. There's a reason that they only expect you to play this in ten minute bursts. $15 is just way, way, too much.

I've lost count of how many times I've told myself "That's impossible" playing this game. 

I've also lost count of how many times I've proven myself wrong. 

Desktop dungeons is an amazing puzzle/strategy game disguising itself as a dungeon crawler. It's a game for people who enjoy figuring out the minutia of the game's mechanics and using them to squeeze every little extra bonus you can out. As many other reviews have pointed out, it's a great distraction for over a lunch break or when you generally need to kill about 10-15 minutes. The semi-random nature of the dungeons can lead to some runs that are genuinely impossible, but I've rarely felt cheated by it because of the small time investment. Nearly 150 hours in, and having cleared over 90% of the game, and I can still say that there's still plenty of "that's impossible" left in this game.

This is a very good game. It's a rogue-lite dungeon crawler where you always know exactly how much damage you and the enemy will do, so you always know if hitting something will kill you. This leads to you running to and fro in the dungeon, preying on weak enemies, throwing everything you have at monsters two levels above you for an experience boost. I frequently find myself betraying one god, worshipping another, downing three potions, and killing the big boss to leave myself with a handful of health. 

Rogue-lite in this case means that you unlock new classes which give huge gameplay changes and new races which give different small buffs that occur only when you trash items.

13874254.review:
Had my eye on this one for awhile. I picked it up on the 2014 Holiday Steam Sale for 50% off (~$8 USD). I've been very satisfied with it and was a little gem among a lot of games that I picked up last year.

Pros:
+ solid tutorial
+ fun and funny mini-questing/story line
+ good aesthetics
+ varied soundtrack with good music
+ kingdom upgrade system adds meaning/progression
+ challenging
+ procedural generation = big replay value
+ high satisfaction level when solving troublesome dungeons
+ tons of gameplay/replay value
+ great value on sale, good value for most at full price
+ unique

Cons (not many so I am grasping at straws)
- Not as casual of a game as advertised (you need a strong knowledge of the interactions between abilities/effects/statuses etc.)
- Could have high frustration level for some
- Perhaps too much puzzle and not enough dungeon crawler
- Aesthetics may be confused with graphics making it undesirable tosome (yes, this game has bad graphics, but good aesthetics)

I’d definitely recommend it if you like to think, strategize, and take your time to make a move in games. Great for people on the go, but perhaps I’m a bit slow/dumb, because the puzzles take me longer than 15 mins usually.

13848286.review:
One of my favorites but I feel this a very tough game to rate. I cannot think of any other like it and it succeeds on so many levels that I am blown away by the amount of time and energy it must have taken to create this. That being said many of my friends would (and have) toss this aside very quickly. The best comparison I can think of for this game would be chess, crosswords, or suduko not because this game operates by the same level or rules but because of the amount of mental energy required to play well (or poorly but with maximum effort in my case).

On a high note this game does an excellent job of rewarding progress. Even nearly 80 hours into the game I am still unlocking new aspects every couple hours. The high difficulty factor and this make every finished map lead to both a sigh of relief and quick inhale of anticipation as to what might be next. There are not too many titles you can find that can or will provide this.

The game is a puzzle/roguelike/rpg with a steeeeep learning curve. It goes from fairly easy, to somewhat challenging to difficult to "okay quit smacking me in the balls" tough in a span of about 2 hours or playtime each at which point the challenge continues to escalate as you progress through each map after. I personally enjoy the challenge but I think this is a balancing issue that is likely to turn away alot of people before they really get into the game. This is a shame because of the amazing amount of possiblities and strategies you can and will need to master to get through it. I have to grudgengliny give it a slight knock for this.

The only other major criticism I have is that the tutorial is a bit limited. In a game that gives you such progression the mechanics of many of the aspects are not clearly explained. There are puzzles that come with many of the unlocks that are obviously suppose to help out with this. Unfortunately they are pretty limited (and freakin hard as hell themselves) and do not provide you with much help. This can add on to the frustration level pretty damn quick.

The graphics are obviously not the draw here but the cartoony and light-hearteness of the game provide a nice counterpoint to the toughness factor. 

All in all if you own or play mostly titles that contain the tags "board games, tcg, puzzles, strategy, tactical" there is a really good chance this is a gonna be one of your favorites. If your looking for something light-hearted and dislike high difficulty you are likely better off walking the other way.  Objectively I rate his high for orignality and length of content as well as awe-inspiring game design and detract slightly for the poorly explained mechanics and balancing issues.

7/10

bump this to 9/10 if your a fan of puzzles and high challenge...

10/10

Жанр "rogue-like", или просто "рогалики", сейчас как будто переживает свой расцвет. Делаются такие игры сравнительно быстро и просто, в том числе одиночками-энтузиастами. Если я правильно помню, именно такой энтузиаст сделал первую версию этой игры, бесплатную, с графикой попроще (но нисколько не хуже в контексте жанра). Собственно в свое время я заиграл бесплатную версию до дыр и пооткрывал там все, что только можно, не считая пройденной кампании (три карты подряд всего, но любая случайность приводит в переигровке). И эта рецензия - попытка с одной стороны рассказать, какая игра крутая сама по себе, с другой - сравнить ее с оригиналом. А пока что, если это читаете, поиграйте и в оригинал (скачивается с сайта авторов) - не пожалеете.

Удивительное.
Каждый новый шаг - открытие. Новая раса, новый предмет, новая карта, новое божество, и дальше - что же там за поворотом?

Плюсы.
- Механика игры перенесена довольно точно, но сама игра обросла большим количеством разнообразных ответвлений, условий и целей. Налицо принцип "то же самое, но всего побольше", который прекрасно работает в условиях изначально толковой задумки.
- Многие карты представляют собой принципиально новые полигоны, требующие отработки своей стратегии.
- Классы и расы со своими механиками. Еще разнообразнее. Предметов больше, и теперь все легче настраивать.
- Вменяемая сложность. Первые шаги сделают любые новички, но на подходе к локациям с монстр-классами уже придется пораскинуть мозгами.
- Интересные ачивки. Многие побуждают игроков узнавать новые полезные приемы.
- Читайте надписи. Там реально есть юмор :)

Минусы.
- Графика из пиксельно-тайловой стала мультяшной. Имхо, это минус.
- Меньше зависимость от рандома. Уже почти и не рогалик.
- Уровни-головоломки - это все-таки другой жанр, а без их прохождения тяжко.
- Живые доспехи теперь одними файрболлами не закидаешь, грустно.

В общем, если вы любите рогалики, а также пошаговые РПГ или стратегии - не проходите мимо. Мои ожидания после бесплатной версии оправдались процентов на 85.

13597174.review:
TLDR: This is not really a dungeon-crawler... it's an RPG MATHS PUZZLE GAME
I realised the following things when I started unlocking their 'puzzles' which are basically advanced tutorials that don't do any hand holding.

Everyone keeps going on about how awesome this game is, I like it too, but it's not what' you would normally expect froma  dungeon crawler, please let me explain.... forewarned is forearmed....


1st, This is not really a dungeon-crawler... it's a PUZZLE GAME It uses a lot of maths type puzzles - you need to figure out how many minions to kill so that you can level up, and how to do it efficiently... killing higher level baddies gains you an exp bonus, but you need to do it as much as possible so you don't lose XP from minions that are now "lower"... you need to snowball your XP. Levelling up gives you 100%health and mana, and you have to exploit this all game so that you don't use too many potions.... you'll need them for the boss in the level.

2nd, because it's only 10 minutes, things have to be simplified. You move around on a checkerboard style tabletop. revealing a tile (standing next to it = gaining visibility of the next tile) will restore some health and mana.

3rd, this is not a 10 minute game. You can play a dungeon in 10 minutes, sure, so you can play in 10 minute sessions, this can be a positive... but "just one more, it's only 10 minutes" will quickly translate into hours of game play.

4th This is a Rogue LITE - it does have a progression system where you can unlock new classes, abilities, etc between runs, in a similar way to Rogue Legacy. [A true rogue-like features permadeath where you lose everything and start again at level 1.]

For those that like this game, it's addictive. Look at people's play times, the ones that have reviewed this. there are some who have 15-30h, then there are those with 80-120 hours, and the odd one over 200h - that's about the point where you beat the game, from my understanding / reading on the wiki.

Do I recommend this game? That's such a hard one. Yes, If you know what you're getting into when you buy it, but the Store description is deceptive, and doesn't really explain just how this game works, and I was dissapointed about that, I wanted more 'hack n slash', and less 'calculating the next 7 steps to level up without using that mana pot' So for me, Although the game itself seems solid, I do like it, and I will play it some more, but I already know I won't clock it if it requires 200h it's a No.

13526828.review:
People call this a roguelike.  Despite appearances (quests, races, classes, spells, weapons, monsters, potions, etc), it's more like a puzzle game. 

It's a sequence of single-screen dungeon crawls, each with a different character, starting at level 1.  Dungeons are randomly generated, plus there are some semi-random quest dungeons and completely fixed puzzles.  The game rules are simple enough, but complex strategies emerge.  It's easy to learn and difficult to master, although I have to say mastery would be a little more attainable if there were better in-game documentation.  There is of course a wiki.

One last warning: it is addictive.  As in: "Holy crap, is it 4:00 tomorrow morning already?"-class addictive.  Highly recommended.

13512638.review:
At first, I didn't enjoy this game. It seemed fairly random, simple, and frustrating. About 10 or so hours in, I started to understand how the game actually works. Then, things started to click. The game ultimately, is a puzzle game, and a very unforgiving, but rewarding one. Utilize your blackspace effectively, monsters are a resource, leveling up is a resource not to be wasted. 

Having to kill 1 Level 10 boss seemed daunting, but when you think you've finally learned how to do it, they then throw 2 Level 10 bosses at you! How the hell am I supposed to beat that? But guess what? I did it. I was thinking, sweet, I know how to play this game. Then, the next set of dungeons appear. Defeat 3 Level 10 bosses. No way, impossible. how the hell do you do that? An hour later, the first of those dungeons falls. The next thing I know, I have to kill 10 of these bosses? IMPOSSIBLE, and do it 3 times with 3 different classes?

Every time you think you've learned what to do, the game surprises and challenges you to do 1 better. The quest system does get a bit grindy at times, and I have mixed feelings about the lockering system, but this is a great game that's not often on sale, but if you enjoy puzzle games, this will definitely fit the bill.
